A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat-loving elderly neighbor. This film is the first of two modern adaptations of Petula Clark's 1960 hit, Love Almighty, for she and Steve Barri also wrote its counterpart, A Legend Without Desire.
